com.camerontec.catalys.server.ha.collections.registry

Class DistributedCollectionRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.util.collection.AbstractCollectionRegistry
      • com.camerontec.util.collection.StandaloneCollectionRegistry
        • com.camerontec.catalys.server.ha.collections.registry.DistributedCollectionRegistry
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDistributedCollectionWriteAckListener, IReplicator, IDistributedCollectionRegistry, IDistributedCollectionSynchronizationListener, IChannel, IChannelListener, IByteArrayStoreUpdateListener, ICollectionRegistry

    public final class DistributedCollectionRegistry
extends StandaloneCollectionRegistry
implements IDistributedCollectionRegistry, IChannelListener, IDistributedCollectionSynchronizationListener, IReplicator, IChannel, IByteArrayStoreUpdateListener
    Distributed ICollectionRegistry implementation.

    This class is the main entry point into the HA synchronization and replication sub-system.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public IDistributedCollectionWriteAckListener initialize(IChannelFactory channelFactory,
                                                         IClusterDefinition clusterDefinition,
                                                         IDistributedGroupController groupController,
                                                         long replicationTimeout,
                                                         long synchronizationTimeout,
                                                         boolean passiveSiteReplication)
        Initializes the distributed collection registry.

        Data replication and synchronization can only start happening after this method has been invoked.

        Parameters:
        channelFactory - A factory for creating the data channel that will be used for data replication and synchronization.
        clusterDefinition - Defines the cluster's topology.
        groupController - Provides access to live cluster state.
        replicationTimeout - The maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) to wait for the write ack quorum to be reached when replicating a collection write to the rest of the cluster.
        synchronizationTimeout - The maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) to wait for any single response to a snapshot request sent to a remote cluster node when performing the synchronization of a collection.
        passiveSiteReplication - whether the site replication is passive
        Returns:
        The distributed collection registry write ack listener belonging to this registry
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If this DistributedCollectionRegistry has already been initialized.

      • startProcessingSynchronizationMessages

        public void startProcessingSynchronizationMessages()
        Starts processing synchronization messages by this distributed collection registry. Processing synchronization messages should be started once, when the node starts, after it is initialized and the node is ready to process distributed collection messages. If processing synchronization messages is not started the registry rejects incoming synchronization messages. Once processing synchronization messages has been started, it can not be stopped.

      • createPersistentListStore

        protected JournalingPersistentStoreBase createPersistentListStore(String name,
                                                                  Properties properties,
                                                                  JournalingPersistentStoreProgressReporter progressReporter)
        Description copied from class: StandaloneCollectionRegistry
        Creates a new persistent list store with the given properties.

        This default implementation creates a standalone (i.e. non HA aware) persistent store. Subclasses wishing to provide different types of persistent stores may override this method in order to provide an implementation with the desired features.

      • close

        public void close(String collectionName)
           throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: ICollectionRegistry
        Closes the collection of the specified name, allowing underlying resources to be freed.

        If the specified collection is already closed, then this call will have no effect.

        A collection should never be used after being closed. Doing this has unspecified effects.

        Specified by:
        close in interface ICollectionRegistry
        Overrides:
        close in class AbstractCollectionRegistry
        Parameters:
        collectionName - Name of collection to close.
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs when releasing some resource used by the collection

      • replicate

        public void replicate(IReplicable replicable)
               throws IllegalStateException
        Description copied from interface: IReplicator
        Replicates a write request to other cluster nodes and blocks until the expected quorum of write acknowledgments has been received.

        Takes a single IReplicable argument that wraps the actual IByteArrayStore.WriteRequest to replicate. Calls back into the given IReplicable's IReplicable.onReplicationAcknowledged() method to indicate whether or not replication did happen (replication only happens if there are other nodes to replicate to). Then, in the case where replication did happen, blocks until the expected quorum of write acknowledgments has been received or a timeout is reached.
        Specified by:
        replicate in interface IReplicator
        Parameters:
        replicable - wrapper around the actual IByteArrayStore.WriteRequest to replicate
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException

      • publish

        public Future<?> publish(ChannelMessage message)
        Description copied from interface: IChannel
        Publish a message to all subscribers of this channel's topic within the entire HA cluster.

        The means of publishing the message is not defined here. The underlying implementation decides whether the message is sent on individual point to point connections or via multicast.

        Specified by:
        publish in interface IChannel
        Parameters:
        message - The message to publish.
        Returns:
        A future indicating the result of publishing the message. Clients may choose to wait for completion of the future, which indicates that from the perspective of this node the message was sent to all intended recipients. An exception indicates that the message was not sent to at least one intended recipient.

      • publishToLocateSite

        public Future<?> publishToLocateSite(ChannelMessage message)
        Description copied from interface: IChannel
        Publish a message to all subscribers of this channel's topic attempting to limit the scope of delivery to the local cluster site.

        The means of publishing the message is not defined here. The underlying implementation decides whether the message is sent on individual point to point connections or via multicast. However, the implementation must guarantee that when the message is delivered point to point is only received by local cluster nodes.

        Note: If the cluster is configured to use multicast, and this message is suitable for multicast, then multicast is the chosen delivery method. In that scenario the application cannot necessarily limit the receipt of this messages to local cluster nodes. That is, receipt of multicast messages is determined by network topology and the configured multicast TTL.

        Specified by:
        publishToLocateSite in interface IChannel
        Parameters:
        message - The message to publish.
        Returns:
        A future indicating the result of publishing the message. Clients may choose to wait for completion of the future, which indicates that from the perspective of this node the message was sent to all intended recipients. An exception indicates that the message was not sent to at least one intended recipient.

      • send

        public Future<?> send(SocketEndpoint destination,
                      ChannelMessage message)
        Description copied from interface: IChannel
        Send a message to a specific subscriber in the HA group.

        The application must guarantee to send the message to only the intended recipient which means that is must be send point to point.

        Specified by:
        send in interface IChannel
        Parameters:
        destination - The destination subscriber.
        message - The message to send.
        Returns:
        A future indicating the result of sending the message. Clients may choose to wait for completion of the future, which indicates that from the perspective of this node the message was sent to the intended recipient. An exception indicates that the message was not sent to the intended recipient.

        Error message in case of validation failed, null otherwise

      • createExternallyIndexedCollection

                                                            Properties properties,
